This blurb will now be replaced with a far more detailed curriculum letter. Attached to this letter is the curriculum information for all subjects for the remainder of this Autumn Term. In January a new curriculum letter will go home containing information for the Spring Term and a final letter will go home in April with details for the Summer Term.   If you have any questions pertaining to the information contained in this curriculum letter, please speak to the individual teachers at our parent teacher conferences over the next two weeks.   Kind regards   Mrs. Hamilton Key What makes a song Popular? ·       Lyric Writing ·       Creating an accompaniment for a song (Piano or Guitar) ·       Chords and Chord style revision ·       Hooks and Riffs, Repetition the key to a good song! ·       Using backing beats on the keyboard. ·       Performance and recording of students’ songs. ·           Drama ·       Review of First Half Term: characterization, hot seating, conflict, high and low status ·        Gesture, voice, posture, proximity, facial expression, use of levels ·       Areas, features and types of stage; stage directions and blocking; director’s shorthand; drawing stage sets ·        Key rules of stage movement ·       Analysis of blocking: Twelve Angry Men ·        Script analysis and performance of extract: Twelve Angry Men ·       Narrative structure:  The Wizard of Oz ·       Writing, directing and performing group pieces based upon stimulus photographs ·        Dramatisation of contemporary themes and historical events ·       Communication and presentation skills ·       Analysis of advertising ·       Declamation of poetry ·       Researching a historical period from the points of view of costume, make up, setting, stage properties and music   PE Netball/Fitness Testing Pupils will continue to develop their understanding of the Principles of Play by taking part in Netball. Pupils will develop technical skills such as passing, shooting and key movement skills to allow them to be an effective performer in Netball. They will practice and refine the chest pass, bounce pass and overhead pass which will allow them to transfer into game situations. Pupils will discover why we use each pass in different situations and begin to make correct decisions in match play. Pupils will recall the key points that make up B.E.E.F (Balance, Eyes, Elbow, Follow through) which will allow them to analyse their own and others shooting technique. Key movement practices and techniques will also be developed through a variety of practices, allowing the pupils to put their skills into game situations whilst following the correct rules of Netball. As well as skills, pupils will be given ample opportunity to develop strategic and tactical thinking relating to the principles of play. These thinking skills will allow the pupils to transfer them across all invasion games. Pupils will also lead small sessions for others in the group. They will plan and prepare a skill session based on the techniques they have learnt. Towards the end of this term, pupils will take part in a variety of fitness tests. This will allow them to identify their strengths and weaknesses and suggest ways in which they can improve. All tests will be retaken in term two and three. Key Skills: -Passing – Chest, Bounce, Overhead -Receiving – Catching, Body position -Shooting – B.E.E.F -Movement – Footwork, attacking fakes and dodges, with the ball -Leadership and Coaching – Coaching sessions to others in the group -Tactics and Strategies – Principles of play in attack and defense
